content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here's a function written in Julia that would achieve this:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md)
    blocks = split(md, "\n```")
    code_blocks = [replace(split(block, '\n')[2], "```" => "") for block in blocks if length(split(block)) > 1]
    return join([join(code_blocks, "\n\n")]; join=true)
end
```
This function works by first splitting the markdown document into code blocks using the "```" as a delimiter. It then further splits each block into lines and removes the first line (which contains ```), before joining all the remaining lines together. 

Please note that this solution assumes that there is only one language specified after ```` in the markdown, i.e., the julia code blocks are not mixed with other languages' code blocks. If your document includes multiple types of code block languages, you would need a more complex solution.
